author: .vbuterin
content: > but it shows that usage dropped (not the capacity increased, we have variable capacity).

author: .vbuterin
content: You mean the demand curve dropped, not usage dropped, right?

author: .vbuterin
content: As it looks like the usage level is roughly at the same level

author: .vbuterin
content: Aaaah I see there's a slight actual drop on 09/13 20:00

author: .vbuterin
content: And then it climbs back up once the basefee dropped to near-zero

author: .vbuterin
content: On the filecoin implementation, the slack constant (max block capacity / per-block target gasused) is also 2x, right?

author: .vbuterin
content: Do you happen to have stats for what percent of blocks are 100% full, and how often we have chains of 100% full blocks (or close to that) of different lengths?

author: abdel.stark
content: > <@!376568077950910466> What is the status of Geth implementation ? Are you aligned with EIP1559_0 version ? Also do you have more information about the mining issue ?

author: iannorden
content: Hey <@!574864862338088960> I have become increasingly busy with other obligations and need help keeping up with things here, so Vulcanize is in the process of onboarding an additional dev to help with the debugging and maintenance of the go-ethereum branch. In the meantime, no obvious fix has jumped out at me after reviewing the code. The issue, as you know, is a silent failure only when geth is the miner. So debugging it requires a "testnet" of sorts with a single geth miner, a tx submitter, and a full node syncing from that miner.

author: abdel.stark
content: You can use it, let me know if you have some issues

author: abdel.stark
content: it is not as smart as an Agent Based Simulator (BTW <@!486501030046203915> any update on that front ? ). But at least it generates random value transfers from genesis accounts and you can configure the throughput and some other parameters. It can generate both legacy and EIP-1559 transactions.

author: iannorden
content: Yeah that's definitely sufficient for this debugging
